content.text: At what time of year is the passage set?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

subject: english

content.text: The father compares himself and his family to prisoners set free. Why? (lines 2–3) been dropped.
options: A: They had been held hostage by pirates.
B: They had been trapped in their cave.
C: They had been trapped in their house due to stormy weather.
D: They had been caught in heavy rain which had finally stopped.
E: They had been unfairly accused of crimes but the accusations had

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

subject: english

content.text: ‘ ’ The winds at length were lulled (line 1) What is another way of saying ‘ lulled ’ ?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is E

subject: english

content.text: Why might the author have decided to include water references in the first paragraph? (lines 1–5)
options: A: The heavy rain had recently stopped.
B: Rain was still falling heavily.
C: Water makes the setting seem more peaceful.
D: The family hadn’t had a drink for a long time.
E: The family have found themselves on an island surrounded by water.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is A

subject: english

content.text: How many adjectives can you count in the sentence beginning “ We refreshed our eyes… ” ? (lines 3–5)

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D

subject: english

content.text: ‘ ’ in a few days it [the tree-house] was again habitable (line 7) What does this mean?
options: A: The family soon got used to the damage to the tree-house.
B: The tree-house was rapidly transformed into a luxury home.
C: The family were soon able to live in the tree-house again.
D: The tree-house was destroyed again within a few days.
E: The tree-house quickly dried out by itself.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

subject: english

content.text: Where had the family kept their supplies over the winter?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

subject: english

content.text: How did the family attempt to rescue their supplies?
options: A: They shook all of the water off them.
B: They fetched new materials to mend them.
C: They took them to the tree-house instead of the tent.
D: They made a fire to dry them out.
E: They placed them out in the sun to dry.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is E

subject: english

content.text: The father considered the damage inflicted on their property ‘ irreparable ’ . (line 12) What does this word suggest he thought about the damage?
options: A: It would be easy to repair the damage.
B: The damage was likely to be repeated.
C: The damage could be repaired but it would be difficult.
D: It would be impossible to repair all of the damage.
E: The father had never seen damage like it before.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D

subject: english

content.text: ‘ ’ What is meant by quarters (line 13) ?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

subject: english

content.text: What do we know about the climate on the island?
options: A: The island is protected from heavy winds.
B: There is a rainy season.
C: The climate is very consistent.
D: Despite being warm, there is not much sun.
E: It rains all the time.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

subject: english

content.text: Based on the passage, what was the main goal of hollowing out a cave in the rock?
options: A: to provide a look-out point to watch for enemies
B: to provide a space for their animals
C: to test how much water had got into the rock
D: to provide an extra room in case they had visitors
E: to provide accommodation for the winter season

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is E

subject: english

content.text: If they only managed to carve out a smaller cave, what did the father hope to use it as?
options: B: a house for their dog
C: a playroom for the children
D: a storage space for supplies
E: a shelter for rain showers

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D

subject: english

content.text: How easy did the father think it would be to carve out a cave?
options: B: easy as long as they set their minds to it
C: quite difficult, with no guarantee of success
D: so difficult it was nearly impossible

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D

subject: english

content.text: ‘ with minds bent on success ’ (lines 20–21) What does this imply about their attitude to the work? succeed.
options: A: They were indifferent as to whether they succeeded.
B: They wanted to succeed but struggled to believe they could.
C: They were absolutely determined to see it through.
D: They were so confident they felt they had already succeeded.
E: They worked cautiously because there was a high chance they wouldn’t

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

subject: english

content.text: ‘ incessant toil ’ (line 22) What does the word ‘ incessant ’ say about the work they were doing?
options: A: The work they were doing was very difficult.
B: They kept working without a break.
C: They worked hard but it was having no effect.
D: They worked on and off, taking frequent breaks.
E: The work was uninspiring and monotonous.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

subject: english

content.text: ‘ ’ What would be another word for impression on line 22?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is A

subject: english

content.text: ‘ ’ Why did the family feel relieved after they had started their work? (line 25) of time.
options: A: They knew they couldn’t get any further and could stop working.
B: They had finally begun to make progress.
C: Somebody rewarded them for their six days of work.
D: They realised they could fit their dog in the hole.
E: They had learned from the experience so it hadn’t been a complete waste

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D

content.text: What was the reaction when Jack lost his crowbar? expect.
options: A: Jack’s father was angry because Jack had lost one of their tools.
B: Jack was embarrassed because he looked incompetent.
C: Jack was excited because of what it implied about the rock.
D: Jack and his father were relieved because it meant they could stop work.
E: Jack and his father were nervous because they didn’t know what to

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

content.text: ‘ ’ we battered vigorously at the rock (line 33) Which of the following words is closest in meaning to ‘ vigorously ’ ?

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is C

content.text: What did Jack do while Fritz and his father enlarged the opening of the cave?
options: A: Jack went for a ride on his horse to celebrate the work was over.
B: Jack went to inform his mother.
D: Jack went to collect more tools.
E: Jack had a rest so that he could take over next.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

content.text: What type of words are the following? resolve (line 12) , sprang (line 30) , thrust (line 30) , enlarged (line 34) , thundered (line 35)

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is B

content.text: ’ What was the family s reaction to the cave?
options: A: They thought it was so beautiful they couldn’t possibly make a home inside.
B: They were excited but fearful about what was inside.
C: They couldn’t see much because it was so dark.
D: The cave was as they had expected and they immediately felt at-home.
E: They were overwhelmed at the dazzling appearance.

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is E

content.text: Why was the cave considered suitable as a home?
options: A: because it resembled the family’s previous home
B: because it was high and hidden from animals
C: because the crystal made it brighter inside
D: because the hard, dry sand would protect against damp
E: because it was warm inside

explanation: Reading Comprehension: The correct answer is D
